segments.text: I notice the way the woman stands so confidently at the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost calming to see her immersed in her task, the rhythm of her drying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, there’s a striking chaos happening just out of her view.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is climbing the stool, and I can feel my heart race as I watch him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It looks so unstable, tilting backward with every little movement he makes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn’t he understand the danger he’s putting himself in?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the girl waits eagerly, her hand outstretched, expecting a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but think they must know they're up to no good.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The mess at the woman’s feet only grows larger, and she’s completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish she'd look down, see the puddle, see the risk before it escalates.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast of the tidy garden outside only amplifies the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a peaceful scene beyond the window, while inside, mischief brews.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a pang of frustration for the woman, lost in her own world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout a warning, but I just stand here, watching it unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There's an impending sense of disaster, and I can't shake it off.
segments.speaker: PAR
